item.description:
The Debt begins in 1997, as shocking news reaches retired Mossad secret agents Rachel (Helen Mirren) and Stephan (Tom Wilkinson) about their former colleague David (Ciarán Hinds). All three have been venerated for decades by Israel because of the secret mission that they embarked on for their country back in 1965-1966, when the trio—portrayed, respectively, by Jessica Chastain, Marton Csokas and Sam Worthington—tracked down Nazi war criminal Dieter Vogel (Jesper Christensen), the feared Surgeon of Birkenau, in East Berlin. While Rachel found herself grappling with romantic feelings during the mission, the net around Vogel was tightened by using her as bait. At great risk, the team's mission was accomplished—or was it? The suspense builds across two different time periods, with startling action and surprising revelations that compel Rachel to take matters into her own hands. Academy Award nominee John Madden (Shakespeare in Love) directs this espionage thriller, which was adapted from the 2007 Israeli film Ha-Hov. (Partially subtitled) Official Web Site

 

After we'll go to one of the usual watering holes.  I may try to get reservations at Hungry Mother.  I"m limiting this to 8 people so that we can all enjoy the same conversation.

 

A thriller sounds like just thing to start off fall and pre-primary season
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be outside the theater from about 3:55 - 4:05. After that I'll try to sit in dead center. After, I'll be on the right side of the theater collecting people.
item.name: The Debt at Kendall Square Cinema
